docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 23 -- The new seven-nation Latin-American Free Trade Association opens a conference here tomorrow to start working out details of a program to reduce trade barriers.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 23 -- The new seven-nation Latin-American Free Trade Association opens a conference here tomorrow to start working out details of a program to reduce trade barriers.

headline.main: LATIN TRADE GROUP OPENS TALKS TODAY

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANIERO, July 24 -- Foreign Minister Afonso Arinos de Melo Franco told a Soviet goodwill mission today that Brazil hoped to establish diplomatic relations with the Soviet Union "very shortly."
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANIERO, July 24 -- Foreign Minister Afonso Arinos de Melo Franco told a Soviet goodwill mission today that Brazil hoped to establish diplomatic relations with the Soviet Union "very shortly."
docs.abstract: Arinos do Melo Franco decorates mission; says he hopes for diplomatic ties with USSR shortly; Quadros 'independent' policy toward US linked

headline.main: BRAZIL PLANS TIE WITH SOVIET SOON; Foreign Minister Also Tells Russians of Trade Hopes

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 24 -- The Latin American Free Trade Association was formally opened for business here tonight. The seven-nation group had an oversupply of red ink and black clouds and a full measure of hope and determination.

headline.main: LATIN TRADE UNIT OPENS FIRST TALK; 7 Nations Meet in Uruguay -- Future Is Beset by Woes

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 25 -- President Janio Quadros announced today that he had given orders for a renewal of diplomatic relations with the Soviet Union.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 25 -- Delegates to the first conference of the Latin-American Free Trade Association have been told that their labors will produce much more than a purely economic integration.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 26 -- Paraguay has requested the six other members of the new Latin-American Free Trade Association to allow her primary products and industrial goods to enter member countries free of any tax.

headline.main: PARAGUAY IN TRADE BID; Asks Free Entry for Products Now in New Grouping

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 27 -- An informed source said today that President Janio Quadros had received an invitation from President Kennedy to visit Washington in December.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., July 28--A United Nations inquiry panel said today that the United Nations must intervene in South-West Africa to prevent armed conflict.
